poem:
Title: Shadows on The Kremlin

In the crimson dawn
a voice— once rang, now silent.
Navalny, fallen.

Kremlin shadows lengthen
over Moscow's heart, a truth—
as bitter as frost.

Cold, the political wind whistles,
a mourning dirge for freedom,
a requiem for a voice silenced.

Condolences fall, raindrops on stone,
while far off—
Latvia weeps.
